org.jpac.alarm

Class Alarm

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • org.jpac.Signal
        • org.jpac.alarm.Alarm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class Alarm
extends Signal
    represents an alarm which can be raised by - a module or - by a logical signal which is connected to the alarm as a source signal. Alarms can be shown up to the user over the GUI and acknowledged by him, after they have gone. Alarms have an unique identifier and a message text, which can be part of a resource bundle to manage internationalization

    • Constructor Detail

      • Alarm

        public Alarm(AbstractModule containingModule,
             java.lang.String identifier,
             java.lang.Integer number,
             java.lang.String message,
             boolean resetOnAcknowledgement,
             Alarm.Severity severity)
      throws SignalAlreadyExistsException
        constructs an alarm
        Parameters:
        containingModule: - module which instantiated the alarm
        identifier: - unique identifier of the alarm
        number: - a unique number of the alarm (optional, default = null)
        message: - a message, that can be displayed over a GUI
        resetOnAcknowledgement: - if true, the alarm will be automatically reset on acknowledgement by the user
        severity: - severity of the alarm: ALARM, WARNING, MESSAGE (optional, default = Severity.MESSAGE)
        Throws:
        SignalAlreadyExistsException

      • set

        public void set(boolean state)
         throws SignalAccessException
        used to set/reset the alarm. Whenever the alarm condition is set the acknowledge state of the alarm is reset.
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException, - if the module invoking this method is not the containing module
        SignalAccessException

      • raise

        public void raise()
           throws SignalAccessException
        used to raise the alarm. Equivalent to set(true). Whenever the alarm condition is set the acknowledge state of the alarm is reset.
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException, - if the module invoking this method is not the containing module
        SignalAccessException

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws SignalAccessException
        used to reset the alarm. Equivalent to set(false).
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException, - if the module invoking this method is not the containing module
        SignalAccessException

      • acknowledge

        public void acknowledge()
                 throws AlarmPendingException
        used to acknowledge a pending alarm.
        Throws:
        AlarmPendingException - thrown, if the alarm is not pending and instantiated with resetOnAcknowledgement = false
